title: Bug 102436 - Date/time value not stored correctly in report design
description: Bug 102436 - Date/time value not stored correctly in report design. An invalid date/time string (which does not conform to a universal format or the system-default locale format) should have been rejected.
OB: When a new "DateTime" type report parameter is created in the BIRT report designer, if an invalid date string is entered in the "defaultValue" field, such as "55/66/9999", the invalid value is accepted. The following definition shows up in the report design: <parameters><scalarparameter name="dateParam1"><property name="dataType">dateTime</property><property name="allowBlank">false</property><property name="format">Unformatted</property><property name="controlType">textbox</property><expression name="defaultValue">55/66/9999</expression></scalarparameter></parameters>.
EB: When a new "DateTime" type report parameter is created in the BIRT report designer, and an invalid date string is entered in the "defaultValue" field, such as "55/66/9999", the invalid value should be rejected and an appropriate error message should be displayed. The report design should not contain the invalid date value.
SR:
To reproduce this issue:
1. Open the BIRT report designer.
2. Create a new report.
3. Add a report parameter of type "DateTime".
4. In the "defaultValue" field, enter an invalid date string, such as "55/66/9999".
5. Save the report design.
6. Verify that the invalid value is accepted and appears in the report design.
